revised_title: Descending Degenerations and Lesions of the Gyrus Marginalis and Gyrus Fornicatus in Monkeys
tldr: The author conducted experiments on monkeys to study the effects of lesions on the gyrus marginalis and gyrus fornicatus. They found that descending degenerations occurred along the course of the pyramidal tract after removing or damaging these gyri. The results showed that the gyrus marginalis is part of the motor region of the brain, while the gyrus fornicatus is likely involved in sensory impressions.
